m_szDocTitle: Chicago Enlists Desert Water Experts To Prevent "Water Desert" | CleanTechnica
m_szDocSumamry: March 18th, 2014 by Tina Casey   You’ve heard about urban food deserts, and pretty soon you’re going to start hearing about urban water deserts, too. We’re talking about cities where water in general is abundant but clean drinking water is becoming more difficult and expensive to provide on a municipal level. Well, it looks like Chicago is determined not to become a water desert. Through the University of Chicago, the city has embarked on an ambitious partnership with Israel’s Ben-Gurion University of the Negev to develop new technologies for water recycling, conservation, and purification.
